title: Barrow Gurney Reservoir Walk Route

images.title: Wild Country Lane at junction with B3130, Barrow Gurney by David Gearing, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Nigel Mykura / Reservoir, Barrow Gurney
images.caption: Reservoir, Barrow Gurney. There are two reservoirs just to the east and south east of Barrow Gurney. The A38 Bridgwater Road winds between them. This particular one occupies a large part of the grid square and is popular with fishermen.

description: This circular walk visits the Barrow Gurney Reservoirs in Somerset. The Barrow Tanks are a nice place for a stroll with wildlife such as Great Crested Grebes, Tufted Ducks and Cormorants to look out for on the water. The site is located just a few miles to the south west of the city of Bristol. You can start the walk from the village of Barrow Gurney and then follow country lanes south to the reservoirs. Continue east and you will come to Barrow Common where you can pick up a section of the Monarch's Way. Follow it north and it will take you to the neighbouring village of Long Ashton with nice views of the surrounding countryside and woodland. You can then follow country lanes and public footpaths back to Barrow Gurney village. To continue your walking in the area you could head to the nearby Ashton Court Park. The 850 acre country estate includes miles of footpaths taking you to woodland, parkland and gardens.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Prince’s Motto is located just to the north east of the reservoirs in the village. The historic inn has a charming old interior with vintage photographs, artwork and mirrors. They serve good food and have a garden area and parking. You can find them at Barrow St, BS48 3RY. There's also the Fox & Goose Inn which has a nice outdoor decking area and another fine menu. They are located at postcode BS48 3SL for your sat navs.

display_address: Hobbs Lane, Barrow Gurney, North Somerset, England, BS48 3SD, United Kingdom
